page.title: 11RIVER MANAGEMENT
page.content: The{River Trent}is managed and financed in a variety of ways. There is no charge for craft passing through the lock, but the money is recouped by {British Waterways Board}from the boat licence fee which varies according to the size of the craft. Although{ {British Waterways}are responsible for the maintenance of the river bed, banks and lock, the{Severn-Trent Water {Authority}own the water. The fishing rights are currently leased to { {Nottingham Piscatorial Society}, but this system of leasing is now under review, and a more direct system of renting the fishing rights to individuals is being considered by the {British Waterways Board.
